page.title: 15Lockinge Estate, Ardington 3
page.content: From May 25th to June 2nd 1985 a "Village Enterprise" week was held in 5 villages in Oxfordshire including the Estate villages of Ardington and Lockinge.Many of the new businesses and the Lockinge Estate were open to the public and many of the craftsmen demonstrated their skills.The villages showed very clearly how they had adapted to modern life without spoiling their country settings and without becoming mere dormitories.They have remained true working villages. Ardington School hasbeen allowed to continue.There are 23 pupils aged between 5 and 11 with one teacher and one helper/secretary.The school has a computer with a printer,provided from money raised by parents and friendsA friends of the school.A playgroup meets in a disused classroom.
